metadata.Title: CVE-2019-13750 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Insufficient data validation in SQLite in Google Chrome prior to 79.0.3945.79 allowed a remote attacker to bypass defense-in-depth measures via a crafted HTML page.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-13750` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-browser-l10n - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-chromedriver - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

lemon - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.3
libsqlite3-0 - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.3
libsqlite3-tcl - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.3
sqlite3 - 3.22.0-1ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '79.0.3945.79-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
sqlite: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
sqlite3 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.22.0-1ubuntu0.3').
